newsitem.title: USA: Corestates president Greco to resign.
newsitem.headline: Corestates president Greco to resign.

text.p: CoreStates Financial Corp said Monday its president, Rosemarie Greco, is leaving the company for personal reasons effective early 1998.
Greco is also president and chief executive officer of its unit, CoreStates Bank, the company said.
Terrence Larsen, chairman and chief executive officer of the corporation and the bank, will assume the post of president in both entities immediately, it said.
Greco's other management responsibilities will be divided among several senior executives, it added.
Greco will continue to report to Larsen through the transition until her departure, it said.
"Rosemarie has made her influence felt throughout the CoreStates organization and she will be truly missed," said Larsen, who noted that Greco had "done a lot to build and change our organization."

Greco, who is leaving CoreStates after six years, said it is an "opportune time" for her to step back and take a fresh look at her personal directions, now that the company "is settling down after intense efforts of process redesign and bank mergers and is taking a fresh look at its strategic directions."
